entities.name: Problem Solving Playbook
entities.description: A collection of documented strategies and mental models for debugging complex engineering problems.

entities.name: Variable Reduction
entities.description: Systematically disabling surrounding features to isolate the root cause of a complex interaction bug.

entities.name: The "Disablement" Pattern
entities.description: The tactic of aggressively turning off potential interference completely rather than tweaking it.

entities.name: The "Native Interception" Pattern
entities.description: Intercepting native DOM events at the container level using the capture phase to bypass library handlers.

entities.name: DOM events
entities.description: Native browser event system often abstracted by heavy UI libraries.

entities.name: Capture phase
entities.description: The top-down phase of event handling that occurs before bubbling.

entities.name: Sigma.js
entities.description: A heavy UI library that abstracts away DOM events.

entities.name: Mapbox
entities.description: A heavy UI library that abstracts away DOM events.

entities.name: Three.js
entities.description: A heavy UI library that abstracts away DOM events.

entities.name: Visual Feedback & "The UI is a Liar"
entities.description: Combining visual debugging tools (cursors, logs) with verification of backend data integrity.

entities.name: SQLite CLI
entities.description: Used for raw queries to verify the true state of the database.

entities.name: test_roundtrip.ts
entities.description: A targeted test script used to prove data existence independently of the UI.

entities.name: The "Strip-it-Back" Heuristic
entities.description: Simplifying a misbehaving UI component by removing all non-essential or 'fancy' styles (CSS).

entities.name: The "Isolation Test" Pattern
entities.description: Creating a minimal, temporary environment (Clean Room) to debug a single component outside the complex application bundle.

entities.name: Clean Room Debugging
entities.description: Conceptual name for the Isolation Test Pattern.

entities.name: isolation-test.html
entities.description: A temporary, minimal HTML file used to verify a component in isolation.

entities.name: Alpine.js Method Binding Issue
entities.description: Methods losing lexical scope ('this') when imported using complex wrapping patterns like Object.fromEntries.

entities.name: Alpine.js
entities.description: UI framework/library associated with a specific method binding issue.

entities.name: Object.fromEntries
entities.description: JavaScript method that, when used for wrapping, breaks method scope connections in Alpine.js.

relationships.description: Variable Reduction is a core strategy documented in the Playbook.
The Disablement Pattern is the tactical application of Variable Reduction.
The Native Interception Pattern is a core strategy documented in the Playbook.
The strategy targets native DOM events for control.
The strategy works by enabling and utilizing the Capture phase.
Sigma.js is a library that abstracts away native DOM events.
Mapbox is a library that abstracts away native DOM events.

relationships.target: Visual Feedback & "The UI is a Liar"
relationships.description: This is a documented core strategy.

relationships.source: Visual Feedback & "The UI is a Liar"
relationships.description: Strategy advocates using SQLite CLI to verify backend data.

relationships.source: Visual Feedback & "The UI is a Liar"
relationships.description: Strategy advocates using targeted test scripts to verify backend data.
This is a documented core strategy.
This is a documented core strategy.
Clean Room Debugging is a conceptual synonym for the Isolation Test Pattern.
The strategy requires creating a minimal HTML file for testing.
The method binding issue is specific to the Alpine.js framework.
Using this JavaScript method for wrapping causes the binding issue.
The heuristic is recommended as a preventive measure against complex strategies that lead to this problem.
